result.execSummary:
The defendant David U Heinen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
*Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees by 03-08-2017 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH Tax Intercept.
*Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
With credit for ONE HUNDRED FIFTY-FIVE (155) days time served.  Huber privileges for work and treatment.  Court approved Electronic Monitoring subject to HOC screening.

*Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David U Heinen

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David U Heinen in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.  Additional statements by: TIFFANY H.

Defendant sentenced to serve TWO HUNDRED (200) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for ONE HUNDRED FIFTY-FIVE (155) days time served.  Huber privileges for work and treatment.  Court approved Electronic Monitoring subject to HoC screening.

OTHER CONDITIONS:

* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees by 03-08-2017 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH Tax Intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Sentencing hearing at 03-08-2016 03:00 pm

Defendant David U Heinen in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Br. 33.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant David U Heinen in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Court vactes stay bench warrant.  The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney William J. Reddin in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant is in route to a treatment facility.  Defendant does not appear.  Defense request Court impose and stay a warrant.  State has no objection. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 6.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Case transferred to br 6 for drug treatment court admissions on 02-20-2015 at 2:30pm.
